name: Carrot and Sunflower Seed Bread
author: Kristina Mulcahy Krogh
summary: Healthy buns which could be used for breakfast or lunch. Great for kids' lunch box. Very typical kind of bun from Scandinavia. The yeast used is fresh yeast (also called wet yeast), but dry yeast might work as well.
ingredients: 4 ⅓ cups all-purpose flour, or as needed
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Warm 1 cup milk in a large saucepan over low heat until it reaches room temperature, 3 to 5 minutes
Remove from heat and mix in yeast until dissolved
Mix in egg, olive oil, sugar, and salt
Stir half of the flour into the saucepan
Stir in remaining flour until dough is sticky
Cover and let rise in a warm place for 30 minutes
Divide dough into 12 pieces; roll into small buns
Arrange buns on the prepared baking sheet
Cover and let rise until puffy, about 15 minutes
Brush tops of buns with 1 tablespoon milk
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 15 to 17 minutes
